member.name: T:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D
member.summary: Represent a 2d joint type.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Revolute
member.summary: A revolute joint rains to bodies to share a common point while they are free to rotate about the point. The relative rotation about the shared point is the joint angle. You can limit the relative rotation with a joint limit that specifies a lower and upper angle. You can use a motor to drive the relative rotation about the shared point. A maximum motor torque is provided so that infinite forces are not generated.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Fixed
member.summary: The FixedJoints restricts one angular degree of freedom. Each entity has an axis attached and the constraint attempts to prevent any relative twisting motion around the axes.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Prismatic
member.summary: A prismatic joint. This joint provides one degree of freedom: translation along an axis fixed in body1. Relative rotation is prevented. You can use a joint limit to restrict the range of motion and a joint motor to drive the motion or to model joint friction.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Line
member.summary: A line joint is used to make a point on a body track a specified world point. This a soft constraint with a maximum force. This allows the constraint to stretch and without applying huge forces.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Angle
member.summary: Maintains a fixed angle between two bodies.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Distance
member.summary: A distance joint rains two points on two bodies to remain at a fixed distance from each other. You can view this as a massless, rigid rod.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Friction
member.summary: Friction joint. This is used for top-down friction. It provides 2D translational friction and angular friction.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Gear
member.summary: A gear joint is used to connect two joints together. Either joint can be a revolute or prismatic joint. You specify a gear ratio to bind the motions together: coordinate1 + ratio * coordinate2 = ant The ratio can be negative or positive. If one joint is a revolute joint and the other joint is a prismatic joint, then the ratio will have units of length or units of 1/length. @warning You have to manually destroy the gear joint if joint1 or joint2 is destroyed.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Pulley
member.summary: The pulley joint is connected to two bodies and two fixed ground points. The pulley supports a ratio such that: Yes, the force transmitted is scaled by the ratio. Warning: the pulley joint can get a bit squirrelly by itself. They often work better when combined with prismatic joints. You should also cover the the anchor points with static shapes to prevent one side from going to zero length.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Slider
member.summary: A distance joint contains two points on two bodies to remain at a fixed distance from each other. You can view this as a massless, rigid rod.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.Rope
member.summary: A rope joint enforces a maximum distance between two points on two bodies. It has no other effect. Warning: if you attempt to change the maximum length during the simulation you will get some non-physical behavior. A model that would allow you to dynamically modify the length would have some sponginess, so I chose not to implement it that way. See b2DistanceJoint if you want to dynamically control length.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType2D.FixedMouseJoint
member.summary: Joint to link an elastic rope, trent to 0 distance.

member.name: T:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D
member.summary: Represent a 3d joint type.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.BallSocket
member.summary: The BallSocketJoint restricts all three linear degrees of freedom. Each entity has a point attached and the constraint attempts to keep the two points at the same location. BallSocketJoints are very common and act as the linear component of many constraint configurations. For example, in a ragdoll, every joint has a BallSocketJoint to keep the body together (along with other constraints to handle angular motion).

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.Fixed
member.summary: The FixedJoints restricts one angular degree of freedom. Each entity has an axis attached and the constraint attempts to prevent any relative twisting motion around the axes. FixedJoints have a singularity that can cause instability when the axes are folded back onto themselves. Prevent this configuration from occurring using other limits or by ensuring the connected physical entities will collide before it can happen.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.Hinge
member.summary: The HingeJoint allows one angular degree of freedom between two entities. It is composed of a BallSocketJoint and RevoluteAngularJoint. HingeJoints are commonly used for door hinges, elbows, and axis joints.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.PointPointDistance
member.summary: The PointPointDistanceJoint removes a single linear degree of freedom. Each entity has a point attached and the constraint attempts to keep them at the same distance. A target distance of zero will be difficult to maintain since the constraint only works on a single degree of freedom instead of three. If zero distance is desired between the anchor points, consider using a BallSocketJoint.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.LineSlider
member.summary: The LineSliderJoint is created from a PointOnLineJoint and a RevoluteAngularJoint. This leaves the entities with one linear sliding degree of freedom and one angular degree of freedom. The LineSliderJoint also provides a LinearAxisLimit and a LinearAxisMotor, which are inactive by default.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.PlaneSlider
member.summary: The PlaneSliderJoint restricts a single linear degree of freedom. It is created from a PointOnPlaneJoint and a LinearAxisLimit and LinearAxisMotor for each of two axes on the plane. The limits and motors are inactive by default.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.Prismatic
member.summary: The PrismaticJoint allows a single sliding linear degree of freedom and zero angular degrees of freedom between two entities. It is created from a PointOnLineJoint and a NoRotationConstraint. The joint also provides a LinearAxisLimit and a LinearAxisMotor which are initially inactive.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.SwivelHinge
member.summary: The SwivelHingeJoint allows two angular degrees of freedom between two entities. It is comprised of a BallSocketJoint and a SwivelHingeAngularJoint. The joint also provides control over the free degrees of freedom through its RevoluteLimit, RevoluteMotor, TwistLimit, and TwistMotor which are initially inactive.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.Universal
member.summary: The UniversalJoint allows two angular degrees of freedom between two entities. It is comprised of a BallSocketJoint and a TwistJoint. Itâ€™s useful for transferring twist motion around angles, such as in vehicle drive shafts. The UniversalJoint also provides a TwistLimit and TwistMotor which are initially inactive. These are not complementary to the TwistJoint; the TwistJoint should be inactive if either the limit or motor is active.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Physics.JointType3D.MotorizedGrabSpring
member.summary: Motorized is a special joint to grab an Entity and move it on the physic space.

member.summary: Physic body mass

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.Damping
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear damping of the physics entity.
member.remarks: Values range from 0 to 1, correspondong to a fraction of linear momentum removed from the physics entity over a unit of time.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.StaticFriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the friction coefficient used when the object is sliding slowly.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.KineticFriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the friction coefficient used when the object is sliding quickly.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.Restitution
member.summary: Gets or sets the coefficient of restitution between the objects.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.IsKinectic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the physics entity is kinectic or Dynamic.
member.remarks: Dynamic entities have finite mass and respond to collisions. Kinematic (non-dynamic) entities have infinite mass and inertia and will plow through anything.
member.value: true if this instance is kinectic; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass of the physics entity.
member.remarks: Setting this to an invalid value, such as a non-positive number, NaN, or infinity, makes the entity kinematic. Setting it to a valid positive number will also scale the inertia tensor if it was already dynamic, or force the calculation of a new inertia tensor if it was previously kinematic.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the physics Entity. This Position acts as the center of mass for dynamic entities.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the world rotation of the physics entity.

member.summary: Gets the world transform.

member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation quaternion of the physics entity.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.EnableContinousContact
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [enable continous contact].
member.value:
Whether EnabledContinuosContanct is false fast-moving entities, such as bullets or falling objects, can pass right through a wall or floor.
true if [enable continous contact]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsBody3D.ApplyLinearImpulse(WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@)
member.summary: Applies a linear velocity change to the entity using the given impulse. This method does not wake up the object or perform any other nonessential operation; it is meant to be used for performance-sensitive constraint solving. Consider equivalently adding to the LinearMomentum property for convenience instead.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the motor is enabled. Only Hinge (velocity motor) and Line (servo motor) joints can be motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Motor speed. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property. Only hinge joints can be motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorMaxForce
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Motor Maximum Force. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property and MotorVelocity. Only Hinge and Line joints can be motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Motor damping. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property and MotorVelocity. Only hinge joints can be motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorServoAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Motor Servo World axis. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property. Only Line joints can be Servo Motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorStiffness
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Servo Motor Stiffness. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property. Only Line joints can be Servo Motorized.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.MotorServoGoal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Servo Motor Goal Distance. This property must be used with IsMotorEnabled Property. Only Line joints can be Servo Motorized.

member.summary: Gets the first physics body.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Physics.PhysicsJoint3D.BodyB
member.summary: Gets the second physics body.
